Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery open vessel, possibly a krater; interior glazed black with trace of band in added red near top of sherd; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of swan (head, part of breast, and back remaining; with red dots on neck and wing) to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see the Corintian krater Louvre AM1360 (11).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 268, no. B202)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1040)
